      Returns the most skilled player in the team.
      Methods in hr.fer.oop.lab3 with parameters of type FootballPlayer 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl.add​(FootballPlayer player)
      Adds a player in a collection if he has not been previously added and if there is a space available for a player within a collection.
      boolean Team.addPlayerToStartingEleven​(FootballPlayer player)
      Adds a player to starting eleven if a player is in registered player collection and there is a space for him within starting eleven.
      boolean SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl.contains​(FootballPlayer player)
      Checks whether a collection contains a player.
      boolean Team.isPlayerRegistered​(FootballPlayer player)
      Checks whether a player is registered in a team.
      boolean ClubTeam.registerPlayer​(FootballPlayer player)
      If a team is a national team, a player need to have the same country as a national team; whereas if a team is a club team, a player needs to have player skill which is higher or equal to club's reputation (note: in either case player registration will be successful if there is a space for a player)
      boolean NationalTeam.registerPlayer​(FootballPlayer player)
      If a team is a national team, a player need to have the same country as a national team; whereas if a team is a club team, a player needs to have player skill which is higher or equal to club's reputation (note: in either case player registration will be successful if there is a space for a player)
      FootballPlayer Coach.retrieveMostSkilledPlayer​(FootballPlayer[] allPlayers)
      Returns the most skilled player in the team.
